solution_line_template: There are twice as many zebra enclosures, so there must be {num_tiger_enclosures} tiger enclosures * {multiplier_zebra_enclosures} = <<{num_tiger_enclosures}*{multiplier_zebra_enclosures}={num_zebra_enclosures}>>{num_zebra_enclosures} zebra enclosures.

This means there are {num_zebra_enclosures} zebra enclosures * {multiplier_giraffe_enclosures} = <<{num_zebra_enclosures}*{multiplier_giraffe_enclosures}={num_giraffe_enclosures}>>{num_giraffe_enclosures} giraffe enclosures.
In the tiger enclosures, there are {num_tiger_enclosures} tiger enclosures * {tigers_per_enclosure} = <<{num_tiger_enclosures}*{tigers_per_enclosure}={total_tigers}>>{total_tigers} tigers.
In the zebra enclosures, there are {num_zebra_enclosures} zebra enclosures * {zebras_per_enclosure} zebras = <<{num_zebra_enclosures}*{zebras_per_enclosure}={total_zebras}>>{total_zebras} zebras.

In the giraffe enclosures, there are {num_giraffe_enclosures} giraffe enclosures * {giraffes_per_enclosure} giraffes = <<{num_giraffe_enclosures}*{giraffes_per_enclosure}={total_giraffes}>>{total_giraffes} giraffes.

So in total, there are {total_tigers} tigers + {total_zebras} zebras + {total_giraffes} giraffes = <<{total_tigers}+{total_zebras}+{total_giraffes}={total_animals}>>{total_animals} animals in the zoo.
